Contributor: Godwin, Frank, 1889- artist.; Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Initials "F.G." (Frank Godwin). Date based the date of the Second Liberty Loan drive. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Second Liberty Loan campaign.  The text says that people should sacrifice their ease and luxury for rights and liberty. Men of America should pour out their dollars to back up their belief in justice. Illustration shows two men at a table with coins and Liberty bonds. "The World", represented by soldiers of the Axis and Allied forces, watches from the left.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: Why do you hesitate?
